title: Accident Video Diffusion for Accident Video Description
author: Cheng Li (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University), Keyuan Zhou (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University), Tong Liu (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University), Yu Wang (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University), Mingqiao Zhuang (College of Foreign Language and Literature, Fudan University), Huan-ang Gao (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University), Bu Jin (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University), Hao Zhao (Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University)
relevance_why: The AVD2 framework focuses on improving accident scene understanding and generating detailed descriptions. This can be useful for developing audio-language models that require nuanced contextual understanding.
background: The task involves generating realistic traffic accident videos and providing detailed descriptions for understanding causes and preventive measures in autonomous driving contexts.
contribution: This paper introduces the AVD2 framework to solve the problem of traffic accident understanding, achieving state-of-the-art performance in video description and reasoning.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methodologies struggle to model the complexities of real-world traffic accidents effectively.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by integrating a video generation pipeline with self-critical sequence training for better contextual alignment in accident descriptions.

key_innovation: The unique combination of realistic video generation with detailed natural language reasoning to enhance accident analysis.
real_world_impact: This framework can significantly enhance the safety and reliability of autonomous vehicles, ultimately improving public trust in self-driving technology.

new_terms.Self-Critical Sequence Training (SCST): **Self-Critical Sequence Training (SCST)** is a reinforcement learning approach that optimizes sequence generation models based on evaluation metrics instead of traditional likelihood methods.

open_sourcing: Project resources are available at https://an-answer-tree.github.io
